history.content:
With the new semester, I figured it would be a good time to review the room reservations policies for Soda Hall. This is not a comprehensive list but should get you started. Here's what you need to know:

1. Yes, a human reads your reservation and either confirms or declines it. This means:

  • Your reservation is NOT confirmed until you receive an email saying so!
  • You need to allow 1 business day for your reservation to be processed.

2.  The following rooms are restricted use in Soda Hall:

  • Soda 732 and 734 can only be used by graduate students for research meetings, for DSP exams, and for academic probation conversations.
  • Soda 326 is a recording studio that can only be used to record video for class purposes or to create department promotional materials
  • Soda Alcoves 341A and 341B are reserved for upper division students and to support upper division classes.

3.  Office Hours, Tutoring, and One-on-One meetings should be held in the alcoves on the 2nd, 4th, and 6th floors (unless you're upper div & then you can use the 3rd floor alcoves).

4.  No food or beverages are allowed in Soda 306 (the HP Auditorium).

5. If you ask to reserve the Woz Lounge on either Saturday or Sunday, we will ask you for a chart string account number to pay for mandatory extra cleaning.

6. Be a good EECS community member and adhere to the following rules. Failure to do so makes a lot of extra work for other people and can jeopardize your ability to reserve rooms in Soda Hall in the future. Oh, and please know that if you book the room, we hold you accountable for it's condition if someone complains - it doesn't matter who in the group made the mess.

  • Do not move chairs or other furniture from room to room. Also do not change the configuration of the room without changing it back the way you found it. And hey, making sure the room is clean with you leave is a good idea too.

  • Pizza Boxes and other food trash? Take them to the dumpster on the West side of Etcheverry Hall. Placing trash on the floor near a trashcan isn't acceptable.

Need to know how to book a room? Read the actual room reservation policy for Soda & Cory Halls.

Need keys to Soda Hall? Check out the first 2 links on the Soda Hall facilities page.
